Tyler Daniels is no longer able to access his accounts (Picture: Facebook/Tyler Daniels) An unemployed man who hadÂ just 90p in his bank account, claimed he woke up to find he was ÂŁ1.2million overdrawn – despite having no overdraft facility. 
Tyler Daniels, 21, from Corringham, Essex, now has to rely on his grandfather for money while Barclays investigate.

He wrote on Facebook: ‘I woke up to my current account overdrawn by almost 1.2 million.
The man claimed he doesn’t even have an overdraft facility (Picture: Facebook/Tyler Daniels) ‘I have been on the phone to Barclays for over 2 hours talking to various departments including the fraud department.

‘I was then told in branch that I couldn’t take cash out my savings account as Barclays has blocked all my accounts.’
Barclays is investigating (Picture: Getty Images) Daniels said he has only had the account since October 2016 and never had an overdraft option.

‘We are carrying out a thorough investigation.’
